page.title: 13Transport in Woodchurch
page.content: The majority of occupants in Woodchurch have atleast 1{car}and are able drivers.There is a daily{omnibus service.From Monday to Friday the timetable is 6 'buses' to Tenterden and 1 to Ashford.On Saturday there are 3 'buses' to Tenterden and 1 to Ashford.The price of this service is 75p adult return and 50p children return.There are no 'buses' on Sundays and Bank Holidays.Up until the age of 17,{bicycles}are the main means of transport.{Motorcycles}are often seen travelling through Woodchurch.Every week an{ambulance}comes to collect Old aged pensioners and take them to the day centre at "West Veiw Hospital" or to take them to go shopping in a nearby town.At Woodchurch C of E Primary school there is a{taxi}to take the children to and from school,if they live more than 2 miles away.
